SEARCH
Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.lyzhenkov.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.lyzhenkov.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements JarImpler
This class allows you to implement/extend the given interface/class. To create a .java class, the ClassSupplier class is used. The resulting classes can be packed into a .jar file.
Author:
Lyzhenkov Alexander (alexanderlyzhenkov@gmail.com)

  • Method Details

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: Impler
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: JarImpler
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      jarFile - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • cleaningTempDirs

      private static void cleaningTempDirs(Path tempDir, Path tempBinDir) throws ImplerException
      Recursively cleans temporary directories by deleting all files and subdirectories within them.
      Parameters:
      tempDir - the root directory of temporary files to be deleted.
      tempBinDir - the root directory of temporary binary files to be deleted.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if there are issues accessing files or deleting temporary directories, an ImplerException is thrown with the appropriate message.
      See Also:
      • Files.walkFileTree(Path, FileVisitor)

    • createPath

      private static Path createPath(String first, String... others) throws ImplerException
      Creates a Path by merging the specified strings into a single path.
      Parameters:
      first - the first part of the path.
      others - additional strings representing subsequent parts of the path.
      Returns:
      a Path representing the merged path.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if there is an error creating the path due to invalid path components, an ImplerException is thrown with the appropriate message.

    • compilerFiles

      private static void compilerFiles(String pathToBin, String classpath, String... args) throws ImplerException
      Compiles Java files using the system Java compiler. If the pathToBin is not null, then the compiled files will be located along this path, otherwise next to the Java source files. Any generated compilation diagnostics will be written to System.in, System.err and System.out.
      Parameters:
      pathToBin - the path to the directory where compiled files will be stored.
      classpath - the classpath to be used during compilation.
      args - compilation files passed to the compiler.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - - thrown with the corresponding error message
      • if the args or classpath are null
      • if the system Java compiler is null
      • if compilation fails with a non-zero exit code
      See Also:
      • Tool.run(InputStream, OutputStream, OutputStream, String...)

    • createAbsolutePath

      private static Path createAbsolutePath(Class<?> token) throws ImplerException
      Creates an absolute path to the location of the class represented by the Class<?> object.
      Parameters:
      token - the Class object representing the class for which to create an absolute path.
      Returns:
      the absolute path to the location of the class.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if failed to obtain the absolute path or convert URL to URI, an ImplerException is thrown with the appropriate message.
      See Also:
      • Class.getProtectionDomain()
      • URL.toURI()

    • createTempDir

      private static Path createTempDir(String root, String prefix) throws ImplerException
      Creates a temporary directory with the specified root directory and prefix.
      Parameters:
      root - the root directory where the temporary directory will be created.
      prefix - the prefix to be used for the name of the temporary directory.
      Returns:
      a Path object representing the newly created temporary directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - - is thrown with the relevant error details
      • if the prefix is invalid for creating a temporary folder
      • if there are security restrictions, unsupported operations

    • checkForImplementing

      private static void checkForImplementing(Class<?> token) throws ImplerException
      Checks whether a given class can be implemented or extended.
      Parameters:
      token - the Class object representing the class to be checked.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If the class represented by the token is an array, primitive, enum, final, private, or has only private constructors, it is impossible to implement or extend it.
      See Also:
      • Modifier

    • createPathToFile

      private static Path createPathToFile(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Creates a Path object representing the file path for the generated implementation file. In this case, the JAVA_SUFFIX is added to the simple class name and creates parent directories for the resulting path.
      Parameters:
      token - the Class object representing the class for which the implementation file will be created.
      root - the root directory where the implementation file will be located.
      Returns:
      a Path object representing the file path for the generated implementation file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the input path is invalid, or if there are issues creating the parent directories.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point for the program. Parses input arguments and delegates to Implementor for implementing classes or creating JAR files based on the provided arguments. Prints error messages for invalid arguments or implementation failures in System.err.
      Parameters:
      args - expects either 2 arguments to implement the interface/class, where the first argument is the name of the binary interface/class that needs to be implemented, and the second is the root to save the resulting file.

      Or 3 arguments, if you need to create a JAR file for the implemented interfaces/classes, with the first argument being -jar to create the JAR file, the second argument is similar to the previous situation, the third is the path to the expected jar file.
